intro: Loasa stenocaepa, commonly known as the narrow-headed loasa, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. Its leaves are usually simple and alternate, with a rough texture. Loasa stenocaepa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as mountain forests.
